result.execSummary:
All charges against Nathan William Rickards in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan William Rickards is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Officer did not appear for the preliminary hearing.   Attny Motion to Dismiss Count 1, Court Grants

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan William Rickards

records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt:
11:58 AM Court calls case and recites appearances. Commissioner Ward Winton appearing. Defendant Nathan William Rickards in court, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Nathan William Rickards.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Taber states have filed a motion for joinder in this case and case # 22CF66.  State has no objection. A dismissal will be filed in one of the cases by the State.   Status set.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

COMBINED BOND: 22CF66 & 22CF136 
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:14 AM Court calls case and recites appearances. Defendant Nathan William Rickards appeared by video.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Nathan William Rickards. Reset
Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:34 AM Defendant Nathan William Rickards appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Nathan William Rickards.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Taber indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    11:36 AM  OFF THE RECORD:  11:39 AM BACK ON THE RECORD:   State calls witness, City of Hayward Officer J. Anderson, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.   11:40 AM  Objection by Attny Taber, personal knowledge and rules of evidence. Discussion follows.    Attny Taber renewed objection of personal knowledge and request dismissal of count 1 and move forward with Count 2.  Court indicates no officer showed up to testify and City of Hayward Officer, J. Anderson was called for wrong case.    Court grants Attny Taber motion and dismiss Count 1.
Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

8:46 AM Defendant Nathan William Rickards appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court enters NG Plea to Counts 2 and 3.  DEF request preliminary hearing to be set within time limits.   Court sets, finds good cause to go outside time limits..
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
